p: Aerobic psychotropic gram‐negative bacteria, enteropathogenic bacteria, heterofermentative lactobacilli, and spore‐forming bacteria are known as spoilage microorganisms in dairy products. Cheese formulation, processing, packaging, storage, distribution, besides intrinsic conditions like moisture content , pH and storage time temperature regulate the spoilage rate in cheese products (Khorshidian, Yousefi, Khanniri, & Mortazavian, 2017; Ledenbach & Marshall, 2009).
